intro: Malacarya dealbata, commonly known as the white-flowered milk tree, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its distinctive white, fragrant flowers. The plant has a woody stem with a milky sap that can be toxic if ingested. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Malacarya dealbata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and unique foliage.
